intro: Triumfetta setulosa var. gilletii, commonly known as the silky triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves that give it a soft, silvery appearance. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
